title: How to Connect a Microphone to a PS4

steps.title: Plug in the microphone or headset to the PS4 console.
steps.content: Plug in the microphone or headset to the PS4 console. The USB ports can be found in the front slot, in the middle and to the right.

steps.title: Navigate to your PS4 dashboard.
steps.content: Navigate to your PS4 dashboard. Turn on the PS4 and select your avatar to log in to your account.

steps.title: Tap up on the analog stick to access more options.
steps.content: Tap up on the analog stick to access more options. This will shift your apps down and show more icons above them.

steps.title: Select Settings.
steps.content: Select Settings . Use the analog stick to find Settings , which can be found on the right. Tap X to select it.

steps.title: Select Devices.
steps.content: Select Devices . You may need to scroll down a bit to find it. It has an icon of a keyboard and controller.

steps.title: Select Audio Devices.
steps.content: Select Audio Devices . It's the second option down.

steps.title: Make sure your USB microphone is listed as the Input Device.
steps.content: Make sure your USB microphone is listed as the Input Device. Hover over Input Device and tap X to change. If you are using a headset instead of a normal microphone, your Output Device will be the same as the Input Device . If you are using both a headset and a microphone, set your Input Device to your microphone and your Output Device to your headset.

steps.title: Plug in the microphone or headset to the PS4 controller.
steps.content: Plug in the microphone or headset to the PS4 controller. The port is on the front of your controller right below the PS4 logo button. If using a headset where the audio and microphone are on two separate cords, you will need an adaptor to convert to a single 3.5mm jack.
